vernerP1
Class VernerCtrl

java.lang.Object
  vernerP1.VernerCtrl

public class VernerCtrl
extends java.lang.Object

Main class of the Verner Controller. The init() method will initialize all variables, the run() method will then start the whole controller. A first menu will appear, through method menu() , offering some testing features.

Author:
fsiva

Constructor Detail

VernerCtrl

public VernerCtrl()
Method Detail

getConveyor

public vernerP1.Conveyor getConveyor()
Returns:
the Conveyor object, which allows to perform feed() or grating()

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
main method, will just loop call init() and then run(), and gently exit if the variable forceQuit is true.

Parameters:
args -

startBackgroundThreads

public int startBackgroundThreads()
Start all background threads: Conveyor, Menu, ScreenRefresher and Alarm.

Returns:
-1 in case of error. 1 if ok.

stopAllThreads

public void stopAllThreads()
Request a smooth stop to all 4 main running threads.

forceQuit

public void forceQuit()
Mostly called by the Menu, when user is pressing ESC to stop it all. All methods watch the forceQuit variable and will finish asap

skipCurrentPhase

public void skipCurrentPhase()
Mostly called by the Menu, when user is pressing ESC to stop it all. All methods watch the forceQuit variable and will finish asap

init

public void init()
          throws java.lang.Exception
Initializes all variables. Conveyor on Port A (and Grating as D) Ignition on port B Fan on port C Water temp on 1 Gaz temp on 2 Screw temp on 3 Screw contact on 4

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getTempEauCible

public int getTempEauCible()
Returns:
the target water temp

setTempEauCible

public void setTempEauCible(int temp)

getTempEau

public int getTempEau()
Returns:
the stored water temp (will not refresh it), use refreshTempValues() if necessary.

getTempFumee

public int getTempFumee()
Returns:
the stored gaz temp (will not refresh it), use refreshTempValues() if necessary.

refreshTempValues

public void refreshTempValues()
Will refresh the water and gaz value from the sensors, so that get() methods will return current temps. Avoid using it too frequently since some Arduino methods are synchronized.

turnCircOn

public void turnCircOn()
Activates the water pump through Arduino relay.

turnCircOff

public void turnCircOff()
De-activates the water pump through Arduino relay.

isCircOn

public boolean isCircOn()
Returns:
true if the water pump is currently on.

getTempVis

public int getTempVis()
Returns:
the current temperature of the feeding conveyor. A high temp (more than approx 30 deg) indicates that fire may be occuring within the conveyor screw.

isIgnitorOn

public boolean isIgnitorOn()
Returns:
true if the ignition device is currently on.

getState

public int getState()
Returns:
the current state of fire: 2 is ignition, 3 is Firing (Quick increase of temps), 4 is normal running, 5 is stopping/afterburner.

getStatusString

public java.lang.String getStatusString()
Returns:
a string summarizing the status. Used to log.

log

public void log(java.lang.String textS,
                int traceLevel)
Make sure to initialize the bWriter before logging

logWithoutDetails

public void logWithoutDetails(java.lang.String textS)

log

public void log(java.lang.Exception ex)

log

public void log(java.lang.String str,
                java.lang.Exception ex)

runPhase5Stop

public void runPhase5Stop()
Fin de cycle: brûler tout ce qui reste dans le foyer. TODO: stop afterburner after 50% time if gaz temp are less than WT+10

needStartFire

public boolean needStartFire()
Returns true if there is need to start fire, by checking the temparatures

timeToStartFire

public boolean timeToStartFire()
Returns true if current time requires to warm water (False during night)

run

public void run()
         throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Principal method of this object, will decide about state changes.

Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException
